comment:
* The ProcessingInstruction interface represents a "processing * instruction", used in XML as a way to keep processor-specific information * in the text of the document. *

No lexical check is done on the content of a processing instruction and * it is therefore possible to have the character sequence * "?>" in the content, which is illegal a processing * instruction per section 2.6 of [XML 1.0]. The * presence of this character sequence must generate a fatal error during * serialization. *

See also the Document Object Model (DOM) Level 3 Core Specification.

methods.name: public String getTarget()
methods.comment:
* The target of this processing instruction. XML defines this as being
     * the first token following the markup that begins the processing
     * instruction.

methods.name: public String getData()
methods.comment: * The content of this processing instruction. This is from the first non * white space character after the target to the character immediately * preceding the ?>.

methods.name: public void setData(String data) throws DOMException
methods.comment: * The content of this processing instruction. This is from the first non * white space character after the target to the character immediately * preceding the ?>. * @exception DOMException * NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR: Raised when the node is readonly.

methodNames: public void setData(String data) throws DOMException
